item.title: Bike lane on Haverstock Hill near Upper Park Rd, 16th January
item.description:
There’s a safety issue with a raised section of the bike lane/speed bump here and water pools whenever it rains due to a lack of drainage. The raised design prevents water from flowing downhill as it should, creating standing water that makes the area impractical and dangerous for cyclists. This needs to be addressed by either adding proper drainage or levelling the road so water can flow over and continue downhill.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Park Road, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
